line_1: You may regret a faithful lover,
line_2: All my griefs will then be over,

line_1: In my silence see the lover,

line_1: The Bully beat, and happy Lover
line_2: Confess, that Feeling lies all over.

line_1: Suppose your Hero were a Lover.
line_2: This Truth more plainly to discover,

line_1: In vain You tell your parting Lover,
line_2: You wish fair Winds may waft Him over.

line_1: Sweet Blackbird, charm thy listening lover!
line_2: When hopes could smile that now are over.

line_1: It is an awkard, whining Lover;
line_2: I'll tell you, since you can't discover,

line_1: Again may claim it from her lover;
line_2: Can ne'er her squander'd fame recover.

line_1: Soon or late you'll hear a Lover,
He, over head and ears her lover,
line_2: Try'd all the ways he cou'd to move her;

line_1: The haughty Prince, tho' much a lover,
line_2: Beauties would run to be sketch'd over;
